subject: YOUR SURE AND STEADY ANCHOR
verse: We have this hope as an anchor for the soul, firm and secure. (Hebrews 6:19)
reflection: THE ANCHOR is an ancient Christian symbol of hope, security and steadfastness. when the future feels uncertain, and you are disoriented or confused turn to this verse. Jesus is your security. He is an anchor for your soul. Today's Prayer: God, You are the Rock of my Salvation, sustain and support me through fearful times.
prayer: Almighty God, as our anchor in life's turbulent seas, we cling to Your unwavering strength and steadfast love. Grant us the courage to trust in Your divine guidance, especially when we feel lost or afraid, and help us to remember that our hope is securely fastened in You. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 173ac8267fd703a5
subject   : Subject: YOUR SURE AND STEADY ANCHOR (8-2-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 1 Aug 2020 19:11:34 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today's Verse:*
*We have this hope as an anchor for the soul,*
*firm and secure. (*Heb. 6:19)

*Today's Reflection:*
THE ANCHOR is an ancient Christian symbol
of hope, security and steadfastness. when the
future feels uncertain, and you are disoriented
or confused turn to this verse. Jesus is your
security. *He is an anchor for your soul.*

*Today's Prayer:*
*God, You are the Rock of my Salvation, sustain*
*and support me through fearful times.*
* Pastor Sather*

subject: THE GRACE OF GRATITUDE
verse: For it is by grace that you have been saved, through faith—and this is not from yourselves, it is the gift of God. (Ephesians 2:8)
reflection:
DO YOU MAKE the mistake of thinking that
if everything isn’t going your way you can’t
possibly feel gratitude for the things that are?
Gratitude is in and of itself a form of peace.
When you recognize simple blessings, you
open your heart to feel God’s presence.
Today’s Prayer:
Heavenly Father, thank you for the many
blessings—from sunrise to sunset—that
grace my life.
prayer: Gracious God, help us to recognize and appreciate the simple blessings that surround us each day, opening our hearts to feel Your presence and cultivating a spirit of gratitude that brings peace to our souls. May we always remember to give thanks for Your abundant grace, from sunrise to sunset. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 173b13427c45057b
subject   : Subject: THE GRACE OF GRATITUDE (8-3-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 2 Aug 2020 17:04:12 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*For it is by grace that you have been saved,*

*through faith—and this is not from yourselves,*

*it is the gift of God. *(Eph. 2:8)



*Today’s Reflection:*

DO YOU MAKE the mistake of thinking that

if everything isn’t going your way you can’t

possibly feel gratitude for the things that are?

Gratitude is in and of itself a form of peace.

When you recognize simple blessings, you

open your heart to feel God’s presence.



*Today’s Prayer:*

Heavenly Father, thank you for the many

blessings—from sunrise to sunset—that

grace my life.

*Pastor Sather*

subject: GROW IN CHRIST
verse: But grow in the grace and knowledge  of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ.  To Him be the glory both now and  forever! (2 Peter 3:18)
reflection:
SPIRITUAL GROWTH IS a lifelong process. there is no end to your develop- ment. The closer you grow to God, the more you will realize how much more there truly is! God’s bounteous gifts are infinite.
Today’s Prayer:
Our loving Father, make every day an opportunity to nurture my relationship with You. Amen.
prayer: Holy God, help us to embrace the lifelong journey of spiritual growth, always seeking to draw closer to You and to discover more of Your infinite blessings. May we never cease to be amazed by Your boundless love and grace. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 173b64b68e8e0587
subject   : Subject: GROW IN CHRIST (8-4-20)

to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 3 Aug 2020 16:47:42 -0500

*Today’s Verse:*

*But grow in the grace and knowledge *

*of our **Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. *

*To Him be the **glory both now and *

*forever! Amen.*



*Today’s Reflection:*

SPIRITUAL GROWTH IS a lifelong

process. there is no end to your develop-

ment. The closer you grow to God, the

more you will realize how much more

there truly is! *God’s bounteous **gifts *

*are infinite.*



*Today’s Prayer:*

Our loving Father, make every day an

opportunity to nurture my relationship

with You. Amen.

*Pastor Sather*

subject: KNOW WHEN TO SAY NO
verse: For God gave us a spirit not to fear  but of power and love and self-control.  (2 Timothy 1:7)
reflection:
KNOWING WHEN TO say no or when to ask for help is an important part of life. When your cup runneth over, perhaps it’s time to say no or to look for how you might downsize your responsibilities. When you empty your cup of what you cannot hold, you make room for new blessings.
Today’s Prayer:
Dear Lord, help me to find rest when I’m
stressed. Give me the courage to say no
and ask for help. Remind me that the best
use of my time is serving You.
prayer: Loving God, grant us the wisdom to recognize our limits and the courage to seek support when we are overwhelmed. Help us to release what we cannot manage, so that we may be open to receive Your abundant blessings and serve You more fully. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 173bb906ef7b3399
subject   : Subject: KNOW WHEN TO SAY NO (8-5-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 4 Aug 2020 17:21:12 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse: *

*For God gave us a spirit not to fear *

*but of **power and love and self-control. *

(2 Tim. 1:7)



*Today’s Reflection:*

KNOWING WHEN TO say no or when

to ask for help is an important part of life.

When your cup runneth over, perhaps it’s

time to say no or to look for how you might

downsize your responsibilities. When you

empty your cup of what you cannot hold,

you make room for new blessings.



*Today’s Prayer:*

Dear Lord, help me to find rest when I’m

stressed. Give me the courage to say no

and ask for help. Remind me that the best

use of my time is serving You.

*Pastor Sather*

subject: RESIST FEAR
verse: “Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid or terrified because of them, for the Lord your God goes with you, He will never leave you nor forsake you.” (Deuteronomy 31:6)
reflection:
HOW DO YOU react when worry enters your mind? . What do you do when you can’t seem to ignore or rationalize your fear away? If this happens take a deep breath and pray.
Ask God to fill you with His peace so that you can rest
in His presence. Lord help me grow my faith so that is guards my heart and allows me to manage my emotions. Amen.
prayer: Faithful God, help us to turn to You in moments of worry and fear, breathing deeply and seeking Your peace that surpasses all understanding. Strengthen our faith so that it may guard our hearts and minds, enabling us to manage our emotions and find rest in Your loving presence. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 173c0a3c16f9e731
subject   : Subject: RESIST FEAR (9-6-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 5 Aug 2020 17:00:24 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*“Be strong and courageous. Do not be*

*afraid or terrified because of them,*

*for the Lord your God goes with you,*

*He will never leave you nor forsake you.”*

(Deut. 31:6)



*Today’s Reflection:*

HOW DO YOU react when worry enters

your mind? . What do you do when you

can’t seem to ignore or rationalize your

fear away? If this happens take a deep

breath and pray. Ask God to fill you

with His peace so that you can rest

in His presence. *Lord help me grow*

*my faith so that is guards my heart *

*and allows me to manage my*

*emotions. Amen.*

*Pastor Sather*

subject: DIRECT MY STEPS
verse: Guard my life, for I am faithful to you;  save Your servant who trusts in you. You are my God. (Psalm 86:2)
reflection:
IT CAN BE challenging to rely on God’s
wisdom when you don’t fully understand
His ways. But when you recognize that
your human insight is not as brilliant as
God’s, you can realize your insecurities
and trust His plan. Dear Lord, I invite You to direct my steps right now. I trust that You know what is best for me. Amen.
prayer: Gracious God, grant us the humility to recognize our limited understanding and the faith to trust in Your perfect wisdom. Guide our steps and help us surrender our insecurities, knowing that Your plan for us is far greater than we can imagine. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 173c5d43e3532bc4
subject   : Subject: DIRECT MY STEPS (8-7-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Thu, 6 Aug 2020 17:11:28 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Guard my life, for I am faithful to you; *

*save Your servant who trusts in you.*

*You are my God. *(Ps. 86:2)



*Today’s Reflection:*

IT CAN BE challenging to rely on God’s

wisdom when you don’t fully understand

His ways. But when you recognize that

your human insight is not as brilliant as

God’s, you can realize your insecurities

and trust His plan. *Dear Lord, I invite*

*You to direct my steps right now. I*

*trust that You know what is best for*

*me. Amen.*

*Pastor Sather*

subject: BUILDING SANDCASTLES
verse: On a good day, enjoy yourself; on a bad day,  examine you conscience. God arranges for  both kinds of days so that we won’t take  anything for granted. (Ecclesiastes 7:14)
reflection:
BUILDING SANDCASTLES is something used as a metaphor for wasting our time. Yet sand-castles serve as an important purpose; they allow us to create something that we know will not last; they encourage us to relish the present moment.
Dear Lord, remind me that it is never a waste to be playful and to enjoy the day.
prayer: Holy God, help us appreciate the beauty and joy in fleeting moments, recognizing that even temporary creations can have lasting value in our hearts and minds. May we find delight in simple pleasures and embrace the present with gratitude and wonder. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 173caef0930b4e53
subject   : Subject: BUILDING SANDCASTLES (8-8-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 7 Aug 2020 16:58:50 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Todays Verse:*

*On a good day, enjoy yourself; on a bad day, *

*examine you conscience. God arranges for *

*both kinds of days so that we won’t take *

*anything for granted. *(Eccl. 7:14)



*Today’s Reflection:*

BUILDING SANDCASTLES is something

used as a metaphor for wasting our time.

Yet sand-castles serve as an important purpose;

they allow us to create something that we

know will not last; they encourage us to relish

the present moment.

*Dear Lord, remind me that it is never a *

*waste to be playful* *and to enjoy the day.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: BE STRONG
verse: David also said to Solomon his son, "Be strong and courageous, and do the work. Do ont be afraid or discouraged, for the Lord God, my God, is with you. He will not fail you or forsake you until all the work for the service of the temple of the Lord is finished. . ." (I Chronicles 28:20)
reflection: GOD TOLD HIS people dozens of times "Be strong." Perhaps he tells us this because He knows asks grand things from us, but also because He knows it can be human nature to be discouraged. Are there big plans in your life that you have abandoned because they seemed too challenging? Revisit them now with God's Word to propel you forward. Dear Lord, help me find the courage and strength to carry out Your plans.
prayer: Almighty God, grant us the courage to revisit and pursue the grand plans You have for our lives, even when they seem daunting or challenging. Empower us with Your strength and guidance to overcome discouragement and boldly step forward in faith to fulfill Your purposes. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 173d03a5fc01f5ed
subject   : Subject: BE STRONG (8-9-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 8 Aug 2020 17:39:13 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today's Verse:*
*David also said to Solomon his son, "Be strong*
*and courageous, and do the work. Do ont be*
*afraid or discouraged, for the Lord God, my God,*
*is with you. He will not fail you or forsake you*
*until all the work for the service of the temple of*
*the Lord is finished. . ." *(I Chron. 28:20)

*Today's Reflection:*
GOD TOLD HIS people dozens of times "Be
strong." Perhaps he tells us this because He
knows asks grand things from us, but also
because He knows it can be human nature
to be discouraged. Are there big plans in your
life that you have abandoned because they
seemed too challenging? Revisit them now with
God's Word to propel you forward. *Dear Lord,*
*help me find the courage and strength to *
*carry out Your plans.*
* Pastor Sather *

subject: YOU ARE GOD'S INSTRUMENT
verse: Come to Christ who is the living corner- stone of God's temple. He was rejected  by the people but is precious to God  who chose Him. (I Peter 2:4)
reflection: We have examples throughout scriptures of what happened to people who rejected God's chosen. For one example look at I SamuelIsrael rejected God's judges, instead they wanted a king and that's what they got. that turned out to be a big mistake. We had better began to pray for a leader of God's choosing and pray that we don't get what we deserve, like israel did.
prayer: Faithful God, guide us to seek Your wisdom in choosing our leaders, and help us learn from the mistakes of those who came before us. May we humbly submit to Your will and trust in Your perfect plan for our nation, rather than relying solely on our own understanding. (AI)
original_content:

===================================================================
*Today's Verse: *
*Come to Christ who is the living corner-*
*stone of God's temple. He was rejected *
*by **the people but is precious to God *
*who **chose Him. *(I Pet. 2:4)

*Today's Reflection:*
We have examples throughout scriptures
of what happened to people who rejected
God's chosen. For one example look at
I Sam. Israel rejected God's judges, instead
they wanted a king and that's what they got.
that turned out to be a big mistake. We had
better began to pray for a leader of God's
choosing and pray that we don't get what
we deserve, like israel did.
*Pastor Sather*

subject: HAVE FUN
verse: A time to laugh (Ecclesiastes 3:4)
reflection: When was the last time you had fun? When life gets you down, lighten up and do some- thing that brings you joy. Nurture your child- like spirit by picking fresh flowers, or going out for ice cream, do some-thing you love.
prayer: Gracious God, help us remember to nurture our childlike spirit and find joy in the simple pleasures of life, even when we face challenges. May we embrace moments of fun and laughter as gifts from You, refreshing our souls and lifting our spirits. (AI)

*Today’s Verse:*

*A time to laugh *(Eccl. 3:4)



*Today’s Reflection:*

When was the last time you had fun? When

life gets you down, lighten up and do some-

thing that brings you joy. Nurture your child-

like spirit by picking fresh flowers, or going

out for ice cream, do some-thing you love.

* Pastor Sather*

subject: REMOVE STUMBLING BLOCKS
verse: So if you hand or your foot causes you to sin, cut it off and throw it away. It is better to enter heaven crippled or lame then to be thrown into the unquenchable fire with both your hands and  feet. (Matthew 18:8)
reflection:
We must remove stumbling blocks that cause
us to sin. This does not mean to cut off a part
of your body. For the church it means that any
person, program, or teaching that threatens the
spiritual growth of the body must be removed.
For the individual, any relationship, prac- tice, or activity that leads to sin should be stopped.
prayer: Holy God, help us to discern and remove the stumbling blocks in our lives and in our church that hinder our spiritual growth and lead us into sin. Grant us the courage and wisdom to make difficult choices that honor You and protect the purity of Your people. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 173df91a8b1b9f44
subject   : Subject: REMOVE STUMBLING BLOCKS (8-12-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 11 Aug 2020 17:08:52 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*So if you hand or your foot causes you to sin,*

*cut it off and throw it away. It is better to enter*

*heaven crippled or lame then to be thrown into*

*the unquenchable fire with both your hands and *

*feet. *(Mt. 18:8)



*Today’s Reflection:*

We must remove stumbling blocks that cause

us to sin. This does not mean to cut off a part

of your body. For the church it means that any

person, program, or teaching that threatens the

spiritual growth of the body must be removed.

*For the individual, any relationship, prac-*

*tice, or activity that leads to sin should be *

*stopped. *

*Pastor Sather*

subject: HEAL YOUR WOUNDED SPIRIT
verse: He heals the brokenhearted and binds up  their wounds. (Psalm 147:3)
reflection:
DOES DISAGREEMENT OR resentment weigh on your heart? Jesus tells us to forgive our debtors, to love our enemies and pray for those who harm us. Follow His way with this prayer.
Heavenly Father, please help me to release negative feelings so that I can experience Your true joy.
prayer: Merciful God, help us to forgive those who have wronged us and to love even our enemies, just as Jesus taught. Grant us the strength to let go of resentment and fill our hearts with Your boundless joy and peace. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 173e4ad4a6583a77

*Today’s Verse:*

*He heals the brokenhearted and binds up *

*their wounds. *(Ps. 147:3)



*Today’s Reflection:*

DOES DISAGREEMENT OR resentment

weigh on your heart? Jesus tells us to forgive

our debtors, to love our enemies and pray

for those who harm us. Follow His way with

this prayer.

*Heavenly Father, please help me to release *

*negative feelings so that I can experience *

*Your true joy.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: WHEN GOD SEEMS SILENT
verse: To you, O Lord, I call; My rock, do not be  deaf to me. For if You are silent to me, I  will become like those who go down to  the pit. (Psalm 28:1)
reflection:
SOMETIMES IN YOUR prayer life it might seem as if God is quiet—that maybe He is not present or hearing you. If this happens to you, continue praying. Keep track of your prayers and how you feel.
Often you will discover that this deserted period in you prayer life has brought about the most beautiful blooms.
prayer: Faithful God, help us persevere in prayer even when we feel distant from You, trusting that You are always present and working in our lives. May we find joy and growth in the quiet seasons, knowing that You are cultivating beautiful blooms within us. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s verse:*

*To you, O Lord, I call; My rock, do not be *

*deaf to me. For if You are silent to me, I *

*will become like those who go down to *

*the pit. *(Ps. 28:1)



*Today’s Reflection:*

SOMETIMES IN YOUR prayer life it might

seem as if God is quiet—that maybe He is

not present or hearing you. If this happens to

you, continue praying. Keep track of your

prayers and how you feel.

*Often you will discover that this deserted *

*period in you prayer life has brought *

*about the most beautiful blooms.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: FULFILLING HIS PURPOSE
verse: And we know that God causes everything to  work together for the god of those who  love God and are called according to  His purpose for them. (Romans 8;28)
reflection: God “works in everything” not just in isolated incidents for our good. This does not mean that all that happens to us is good. Evil is prevalent in our fallen world, but God is able to turn every circumstance around for our long-range good. Note that God is not working to make us happy but to fulfil His purpose. Note also that this promise is not for every- body. It can only be claimed by those who love God.
prayer: Almighty God, help us trust in Your sovereign power to work all things for our ultimate good, even amidst the challenges of this fallen world. May we align our hearts with Your purpose, loving You deeply and faithfully as we navigate life's journey. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 173ef0691e4f222e
subject   : Subject: FULFILLING HIS PURPOSE (8-15-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Fri, 14 Aug 2020 17:10:52 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s verse:*

*And we know that God causes everything to *

*work together** for the god of those who *

*love **God and are called according** to *

*His purpose **for them.* (Ro. 8;28)



*Today’s Reflection:*

God “works in everything” not just in

isolated incidents for our good. This

does not mean that all that happens to

us is good. Evil is prevalent in our

fallen world, but God is able to turn

every circumstance around for our

long-range good. Note that God is

not working to make us happy but

to fulfil His purpose. *Note also *

*that this promise is not for every-*

*body.** It **can **only be claimed by *

*those who love God.*

* Pastor Sather *

subject: LIVE BY GOD'S WORD
verse: For the Word of God is living and active,  sharper than any two-edged sword,  piercing to the division of the soul and  of spirt, of joints and marrow, and dis- cerning the thoughts and intentions of  the heart. (Hebrews 4:12)
reflection: LIVE GOD’S WORD—remember the Word of God is not simply a collection of words from God, a vehicle for communicating ideas; it is living, life changing as it works in us. Like a surgeon’s knife, God’s Word reveals who we are and what we are not. It penetrates the core of our mortal and spiritual life. It discerns what is within us, both good and evil. The demands of God’s Word require decisions. We must not only listen to the Word; we must also let it shape our life.
prayer: Holy God, may Your living Word penetrate our hearts, revealing our true selves and transforming us from within. Help us not only to hear Your truth but to courageously act upon it, allowing Your wisdom to shape our decisions and guide our steps. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 173f4352ab5df492
subject   : Subject: LIVE BY GOD'S WORD (8-16-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sat, 15 Aug 2020 17:19:52 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*For the Word of God is living and active, *

*sharper than any two-edged sword, *

*piercing to the division of the soul and *

*of spirt, of joints and marrow, and dis-*

*cerning the thoughts and intentions of *

*the heart. *(Heb. 4:12)



*Today’s Reflection:*

LIVE GOD’S WORD—remember the Word

of God is not simply a collection of words

from God, a vehicle for communicating ideas;

it is living, life changing as it works in us. Like

a surgeon’s knife, God’s Word reveals who

we are and what we are not. It penetrates

the core of our mortal and spiritual life.

It discerns what is within us, both good and

evil. *The demands of God’s Word require *

*decisions. We must not only listen to the *

*Word; we must also let it shape our life.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: PEACE IN JESUS
verse: To everything there is a season. (Ecclesiastes 3:1)
reflection: Relationships vary with seasons and stages of our lives. Sometimes we have control, but often we do not. living in the moment, appreciating what has been, and trusting Jesus for the future is where peace lies. Remember, Jesus will sustain you through every season.
prayer: Faithful God, help us to embrace the changing seasons of our relationships, finding peace in the present moment while trusting You to sustain us through every stage of life. Guide us to appreciate what has been and to place our hope in Jesus for all that is to come. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 173f9a411e6e9c52
subject   : Subject: PEACE IN JESUS (8-17-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 16 Aug 2020 18:39:06 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*To everything there is a season. *(Eccl. 3:1)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Relationships vary with seasons and stages

of our lives. Sometimes we have control,

but often we do not. living in the moment,

appreciating what has been, and trusting

Jesus for the future is where peace lies.

*Remember, Jesus will sustain you *

*through every season.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: FIRST LIGHT
verse: Let the morning bring me word of Your  unfailing love, for I have put my trust  in You. Show me the way I should go, for to you I entrust my life. (Psalm 143:8)
reflection: YOU CAN HEAR God at any time, but in the above verse King David gives a model for listening and hear- ing Him in the morning. When you wake, make time to allow God to speak to you. Each day is an oppor- tunity for you to be guided by His instructions, His daily treasure. Heavenly Father, I am here I am listening.
prayer: Gracious God, as we wake each morning, help us to quiet our hearts and minds to hear Your voice and receive Your daily guidance. May we treasure Your instructions and follow Your path throughout the day ahead. (AI)

date      : Mon, 17 Aug 2020 17:15:50 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):
===================================================================
*Today’s Verse:*

*Let the morning bring me word of Your *

*unfailing love, for I have put my trust *

*in You. Show me the way I should go,*

*for to you I entrust my life. *(Ps. 143:8)



*Today’s Reflection:*

YOU CAN HEAR God at any time,

but in the above verse King David

gives a model for listening and hear-

ing Him in the morning. When you

wake, make time to allow God to

speak to you. Each day is an oppor-

tunity for you to be guided by His

instructions, His daily treasure.

*Heavenly Father, I am here I *

*am listening.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: RIGHTEOUS DISCIPLINE
verse: No discipline seems pleasant at the  time, but painful. Later on, however,  it produces a harvest of righteous- ness and peace for those who have  been trained by it. (Hebrews 12:11)
reflection:
WE MAY respond to discipline in several ways:
(1) We can accept it with resignation; (2)
we can accept it with self-pity thinking we really don’t deserve it; (3) we can be angry and resentful toward God: or (4) we can accept it gratefully, as the appropriate response we owe a loving Father. God is not only a disciplining parent but also a demanding coach who pushes us to our limits and requires our lives be to be disciplined.
prayer: Almighty God, help us to accept Your discipline with gratitude, recognizing it as the loving guidance of a Father and the rigorous training of a Coach who desires our growth and excellence. May we embrace the challenges You set before us, understanding that they shape us into the people You intend us to be. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verse:*

*No discipline seems pleasant at the *

*time, **but painful. Later on, however, *

*it produces **a harvest of righteous-*

*ness and peace for **those who have *

*been trained by it. *(Heb. 12:11)



*Today’s Reflection:*

WE MAY respond to discipline in

several ways: (1) We can accept it

with resignation; (2) we can accept

it with self-pity thinking we really

don’t deserve it; (3) we can be angry

and resentful toward God: *or* (4)

we can accept it gratefully, as the

appropriate response we owe a

loving Father. *God is **not only a *

*disciplining parent but also* a

*demanding coach who pushes *

*us to our **limits and requires *

*our lives be to be **disciplined.*

* Pastor Sather *

subject: WHAT'S YOUR SPIRITUAL AGE
verse: But grow in the grace and knowledge  of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ.  To Him be the glory both now and to  the day of eternity. Amen. (2 Peter 3:18)
reflection:
YOUR SPIRITUAL GROWTH con- tinues until you enter into eternity. Regardless of your chronological age your spiritual age depends on your dedication to your faith. And unlike the negative connotation of old age, having an old spiritual age is a precious gift!
I say it again it should be our deep- est desire to grow spiritually each and every day.
prayer: Holy God, help us to dedicate ourselves fully to our faith, growing spiritually each day regardless of our physical age. May we cherish the precious gift of spiritual maturity and always strive to deepen our relationship with You. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verse:*

*But grow in the grace and knowledge *

*of our Lord** and Savior Jesus Christ. *

*To Him be the glory both now and to *

*the day of eternity. Amen. *(2 Pet. 3:18)



*Today’s Reflection:*

YOUR SPIRITUAL GROWTH con-

tinues until you enter into eternity.

Regardless of your chronological

age your spiritual age depends on

your dedication to your faith. And

unlike the negative connotation of

old age, having an old spiritual age

is a precious gift!

*I say it again it should be our deep-*

*est desire to grow spiritually each *

*and every day.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: STICKS AND STONES
verse: Your unfailing love is better to me then  life itself; How I praise You. (Psalm 63:3)
reflection:
Words spoken against us are among the
most painful attacks we may have to face.
If we trust God, however, these attacks
need not cause any lasting damage.
God alone can satisfy our deepest longings!
prayer: Faithful God, help us to trust in Your unfailing love and find our satisfaction in You alone, even when hurtful words threaten to wound us. Shield us from lasting damage and remind us that Your voice speaks louder than any earthly criticism. (AI)

subject: MAKING THINGS RIGHT
verse: May the God who gives endurance and  encouragement give you the same attitude  of mind toward each other that Christ  Jesus had. (Romans 15:5)
reflection: Just as we take Jesus’ view on the authority of Scripture, the nature of heaven, and the resurrection, we are to have His attitude of love toward other Christ-ians as well. As we grow in faith and come to know Jesus better, we will become more capable of maintaining this attitude of loving unity throughout each day. Let us attempt to grow in faith so we come to know Jesus better.
prayer: Gracious God, help us grow in faith and knowledge of Jesus, that we may embody His attitude of love toward all believers. Guide us to maintain unity with our fellow Christians as we seek to follow Christ's example more closely each day. (AI)

*Today’s Verse:*

*May the God who gives endurance and *

*encouragement give you the same attitude *

*of mind toward each other that Christ *

*Jesus had. *(Ro. 15:5)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Just as we take Jesus’ view on the authority

of Scripture, the nature of heaven, and the

resurrection, we are to have His attitude of

love toward other Christ-ians as well. As

we grow in faith and come to know Jesus

better, we will become more capable of

maintaining this attitude of loving unity

throughout each day. *Let us attempt to *

*grow in faith so we come to know Jesus *

*better.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: BORN OF WATER
verse: Jesus answered, “Very truly I tell you,  no one c an enter the kingdom of God  unless they a re born of water and the  Spirit. (John 2:5)
reflection: Throughout the Bible water is used as a symbol for new life and birth. Water washes away our mistakes and sins. Water reminds us that there is always a chance to start over and begin anew. Wash me and I will be clean.
prayer: Merciful God, cleanse us with your living water, washing away our sins and renewing our spirits. May we embrace the fresh start you offer, emerging clean and renewed in your grace. (AI)

*Today’s Verse:*

*Jesus answered, “Very truly I tell you, *

*no one c**an enter the kingdom of God *

*unless they a**re born of water and the *

*Spirit. **(Jn. 2:5)*



*Today’s Reflection:*

*Throughout the Bible* water is used as

a symbol for new life and birth. Water

washes away our mistakes and sins.

Water reminds us that there is always

a chance to start over and begin anew.

*Wash me and I will be clean.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: COMPLETE IN CHRIST
verse: So you also are complete through your union with Christ, who is the head of every ruler and authority . (Colossians 2:10)
reflection: Many Bible translations use the word fullness instead of complete. In Ephesians Paul reminds us of the fulness we have in Christ. In Jesus, we are filled with all good things.The fullness of God is our re-birthright. In Him we can be satisfied and content. In Him we are complete.
prayer: Almighty God, fill us with the fullness of Your love and grace through Christ, that we may find true contentment and satisfaction in Him alone. Help us to embrace our completeness in Jesus, recognizing the abundance of good gifts You have bestowed upon us as Your children. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verse:*

*So you also are complete through your union*

*with Christ, who is the head of every ruler and*

*authority**. *(Col. 2:10)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Many Bible translations use the word fullness

instead of complete. In Ephesians Paul reminds

us of the fulness we have in Christ. In Jesus,

we are filled with all good things.The fullness

of God is our re-birthright. In Him we can

be satisfied and content. *In Him we are *

*complete.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: GO TO THE LIGHT
verse: When Jesus spoke again to the people,  He said, “I am the light of the world.  Who ever follows Me will never walk  in darkness, but will have the light of  life.” (John 8:12)
reflection: When I am confused and unable to find my way, the Lord guides and returns me to where I belong. I trust Jesus to give me peace. I can reach for Him in prayer, and He leads me back to His holy light. Pray for Jesus’s light to shine on obstacles your dodging as you walk with Him.
prayer: Faithful God, illuminate our path with Your divine light, helping us navigate life's challenges and guiding us back to Your loving presence when we feel lost. May we always trust in Your wisdom and seek Your peace through prayer as we walk with You. (AI)

*Today’s Verse:*

*When Jesus spoke again to the people, *

*He said, **“I am the light of the world. *

*Who ever follows **Me will never walk *

*in darkness, but will have **the light **of *

*life.” *(Jn. 8:12)



*Today’s Reflection:*

When I am confused and unable to

find my way, the Lord guides and

returns me to where I belong. I trust

Jesus to give me peace. I can reach

for Him in prayer, and He leads

me back to His holy light.

*Pray for Jesus’s light to shine on *

*obstacles **your dodging as you *

*walk with Him.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: PROOF OF TRUE LOVE
verse: Jesus replied, “You must love the Lord your  God with all your heart, and all your soul,  and all your mind. (Matthew 22:37)
reflection: Jesus has said if we truly love God and our neighbor, we will naturally keep the com- mandments. This is looking at God’s law positively. Rather than worrying about all we should not do, we should concentrate on all we can do to show our love for God and others
prayer: Gracious God, help us to focus on the positive aspects of Your law, embracing the opportunities to demonstrate our love for You and our neighbors through our actions. Guide us to live out Your commandments not out of obligation, but as a natural expression of our devotion to You and care for others. (AI)

*Today’s Verse:*

*Jesus replied, “You must love the Lord your *

*God with all your heart, and all your soul, *

*and all your mind. *(Mt. 22:37)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Jesus has said if we truly love God and our

neighbor, we will naturally keep the com-

mandments. This is looking at God’s law

positively. Rather than worrying about all

we should not do, *we should concentrate*

*on all we can do to show our love for *

*God and others*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: AN EXTRA HOUR A DAY
verse: Make the most of every opportunity for doing good in these evil days. (Ephesians 5:16 )
reflection:
If you ever feel—that there is never enough time,
ask yourself if you had one extra hour today what
would you have spent it doing? Tomorrow, make
that the first thing that you get done. When you
realize that you can shift priorities and manage
time, you can begin to have more control over
how you spend your day. Lord help me to make the changes I need to make so that I feel better at the end of the day.
prayer: Loving God, guide us to wisely prioritize our time and tasks, focusing on what truly matters. Help us make the necessary changes to find fulfillment and peace in our daily lives. (AI)
original_content:

*Today’s Verse:*

*Make the most of every opportunity for doing*

*good in these evil days. *(Eph. 5:16 )



*Today’s Reflection:*

*If you ever feel—*that there is never enough time,

ask yourself if you had one extra hour today what

would you have spent it doing? Tomorrow, make

that the first thing that you get done. When you

realize that you can shift priorities and manage

time, you can begin to have more control over

how you spend your day. *Lord help me to make*

*the changes I need to make so that I feel better*

*at the end of the day.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: WE ARE NOT RUNNING ALONE
verse: Since we are surrounded by such a great cloud of witnesses… let us run with perseverance the race marked out for us. (Hebrews 12:1)
reflection:
When you read this verse what is the first thing
you notice? Isn’t it telling us that following God
is not a solo endeavor? Remember we are not alone!
prayer: Lord of Life, help us to recognize and cherish the community of believers You have placed around us, supporting and encouraging one another as we follow Your path together. May we never forget that in You, we are never truly alone. (AI)

subject: EXPECT WONDERFUL THINGS
verse: I waited patiently for the Lord; He turned to  me and heard my cry. (Psalm 40:1)
reflection: When You Turn to God. In prayer don’t just wait Patiently—wait expectantly, knowing that God will deliver you from whatever pain or problem you are facing. There is always hope and alway a response to your cries for help. Heavenly Father, because of You I do not need to worry.
prayer: Faithful God, help us to turn to You in prayer with expectant hearts, trusting that You will deliver us from our pain and troubles. May we always remember that our hope is in You, and that You hear and respond to our cries for help. (AI)

*Today’s Verse:*

*I waited patiently for the Lord; He turned to *

*me and **heard my cry. *(Psalm 40:1)



*Today’s Reflection:*

When You Turn to God. In prayer don’t just

wait Patiently—wait expectantly, knowing

that God will deliver you from whatever pain

or problem you are facing. There is always

hope and alway a response to your cries for

help. *Heavenly Father, b**ecause of You I *

*do not need to worry.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject: A PRAYER FOR SEPTEMBER
verse:
Cast all your anxiety on him because he cares for you.
1 Peter 5:7
reflection:
Dear Lord! Kind Lord!

Gracious Lord I pray

Thou wilt look on all I love,

Tenderly today!

Weed their hearts of weariness;

Scatter every care

Down a wake of angel-wings

Winnowing the air.

Bring onto the sorrowing

All release from pain;

Let the lips of laughter

Overflow again;

And with all the needy

O divide, I pray,

This vast measure of content

That is mine today!

James Whitcomb Riley 1849—1916
prayer:
Kind and gracious Lord, look upon those we love with Your
tender mercy—lift their weariness, quiet their fears, and
trade their sorrows for the joy of Your presence. Let
healing come to the hurting, laughter return to heavy
hearts, and Your abundant peace be shared with all in need.
Make us instruments of Your comfort, generous with the
contentment You’ve given us today. Amen. (AI)
original_content:
message_id: 1744680e2fcc8cc0
subject   : Subject: A PRAYER FOR SEPTEMBER (9-1-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 31 Aug 2020 16:51:26 -0500

*A Prayer for September*

(9-1-20)

*Dear Lord! Kind Lord!*

*Gracious Lord I pray*

*Thou wilt look on all I love,*

*Tenderly today!*

*Weed their hearts of weariness;*

*Scatter every care*

*Down a wake of angel-wings*

*Winnowing the air. *

*Bring onto the sorrowing*

*All release from pain;*

*Let the lips of laughter*

*Overflow again;*

*And with all the needy*

*O divide, I pray, *

*This vast measure of content*

*That is mine today!*



James whitcombo Riley 1849—1916
